item.title: Controllability
item.description: 1. What is Controllability? 1.1 Main Concept Let’s say in a linear system: $$ \begin{cases} \dot{x} & = & \textbf{A}x + \textbf{B}u \newline y & = & \textbf{C}x\end{cases}$$ If this system is controllable, then one can choose a control law $u$, and put eigenvalues of the new system in any places one wants, or (same meaning) steer the states of the system in any direction one likes.
